name: nonfulfillment
content:
nonfulfillment noun [U]
(NO SATISFACTION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a lack of pleasure and satisfaction because you are not happy with your life: After a lifetime of nonfulfillment, it was not surprising that he experienced bouts of rage. The sense of non-fulfillment in her personal life contrasted with her very successful business career.
More examplesFewer examplesTheir marriage was characterized by nonfulfillment and anxiety.After a long period of non-fulfillment, she found happiness later in life.The decision not to move overseas contributed to his feeling of non-fulfillment.

nonfulfillment noun [U]
(NO ACTION)
the failure to do something that someone wanted you to do or that you promised to do: The group was protesting against the nonfulfillment of their demands. They were fined for non-fulfillment of their contractual obligations.

the fact of not doing something you shouldfailureFailure to follow the employee guidelines can lead to your immediate termination.defaultThe bank seized his house because his mortgage was in default.malpracticeThe surgeon was sued for malpractice.derelictionHe was dishonorably discharged for dereliction of duty.neglectCorruption and neglect resulted in a government that was weakened enough to be overthrown. negligenceEducational standards deteriorated thanks to the negligence of the administration.
